title: AAC Clyde Space starts work on maritime domain awareness constellation
key_assets: ['INFLECION constellation', 'VHF Data Exchange System', 'Signal Intelligence', 'Synthetic Aperture Radar technologies']
summary: AAC Clyde Space is developing a $32.2 million maritime domain awareness constellation called INFLECION, funded by the European Space Agency and the U.K. Space Agency. The constellation will integrate communications and remote sensing technologies, including SAR, and involves multiple partners, including Iceye UK. The project aims to enhance maritime security and operational efficiency, with commercial services expected by 2028.
why_it_matters: This partnership strengthens AAC Clyde Space's position in the space-data-as-a-service market and highlights the growing role of public-private collaborations in addressing maritime industry challenges. Iceye UK's involvement underscores the increasing adoption of SAR technology in commercial and security applications.
